title: 2016 Clemson Tigers football team
summary: The 2016 Clemson Tigers football team represented Clemson University in the 2016 NCAA Division I FBS football season. The Tigers were led by head coach Dabo Swinney in his eighth full year and ninth overall since taking over midway through 2008 season. They played their home games at Memorial Stadium, also known as "Death Valley", and competed in the Atlantic Division of the Atlantic Coast Conference.  The Tigers entered the 2016 season as the defending national runners-up after a 14â€“1 season that ended with a loss to Alabama in the 2016 College Football Playoff National Championship.[1]
